content: DBS Vickers Securities Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 05 Jun 2018Can I still open a DBS Vickers account to invest in foreign stock exchange even though I do not have a CDP account open? Are there any things that I will need to show/ conditions that I will need to know before opening?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Prakash KumaraswamiLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 04 Sep 2018CDP account is required only if you trade on SGX. However, I recommend you to have a CDP account - Its free, allows you to buy ETFs of different markets (listed in SGX)0 comments0

Gabriel ThamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Investing in foreign stocks do not require CDP because foreign stocks will be held in custodian with your bank or brokerage.​CDP only holds local SG products.​You probably need to take note of the custodian charges and fees, as well as any taxation, when investing in foreign stocks.1 comment0
